cui_name: Selective mutism specific to childhood and adolescence
reasoning: Selective mutism affects approximately 0.7-1% of children in school-age population (ages 4-14). This age-specific variant captures the peak incidence period. Prevalence estimated at 7,000 per 100k in affected age groups. Rare in adults; primarily childhood/adolescence manifestation.
source: American Psychiatric Association. Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-5). 2013; Kumpulainen K. Epidemiology and recognition of selective mutism. Eur Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2002; 11(6):258-265
